Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the tax plans of Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama by stating that they want to raise taxes on all income brackets, when in fact they have stated that they would not raise tax rates for people making less than $250,000 a year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or specific details about the tax plans of Clinton and Obama.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Clinton and Obama want to raise taxes on all income brackets, without providing any evidence or justification for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Clinton and Obama have stated they would not raise tax rates for people making less than $250,000 a year.
Understate: The claim understates the tax plans of Clinton and Obama by not accurately representing their stated positions on tax cuts and rates.
